reviews.comments:
Amanda is a great host and the house is as shown in picture.
The house is full of all basic accessories you need in day to day life and on top of that a special mention it's kid friendly. We have lot of parks around and the lachine canal just a 2 mins walk away to enjoy your evening.

One can definitely stay over there with family.
Très spacieux et bien équipé.

Amanda’s place was a great location for seeing Montreal, just a short walk from the metro station. It can get super hot at night so be sure to leave the windows open a crack and keep the fans on. The place was very clean and has everything you need.
Great location in St Henri - walking distance to coffee shops, metro station, restaurants, Atwater market, grocery store and laundry. Excellent value for money compared with other places in the area.
Logement bien situé à proximité du canal Lachine et des vélos Bixi. Parking gratuit facile en face de l’appartement. La propreté de l’appartement pourrait cependant être améliorée.

Spacious enough for a family of 4, well-equipped kitchen for making meals, and relaxing environment.  Clean and great location (walking distance to trendy restaurants, the canal, grocery stores, and the Metro).  Would recommend!
It was very good

Great little place in a nice quiet neighbourhood. Quick walk to the Metro station, Atwater Market, and great restaurants (Arthur's is amazing!). There's also a handy Bixi station nearby; biking along the canal was great!

Amanda was prompt in responding and helped with any questions we had. Definitely recommend staying here!
Emplacement idéal pour notre séjour. Logement bien adapté pour les familles avec enfants. Les contacts avec Amanda ont été efficace et agréable. Nous recommandons!

Joli appartement, clair, bien situé à côté d'une station de métro (4 arrêts de métro du centre ville) -et petit plus,  vestibule après la porte d'entrée, comme cela le froid ne rentre pas- important au Canada pour les frileux ;.)

Logement agréable bien situé et très silencieux la nuit la literie est confortable.
Nous n’avons pas eu de problème de stationnement dans la rue
 Par contre la seconde chambre n’avait pas de rideau à la fenêtre pour la lumière du jour le matin 
Et la pièce principale est un peu petite pour manger à 4 surtout qu’il manquait des chaises ne serait-ce que pour prendre le petit déjeuner

The place was clean and quiet. Really well located. Closed to the canal for a nice walk with your dog. There is a fence backward that is really accessible and nice for your dog to walk around. Comfy beds and everything we could need was provided. Thanks!
The apartment is clean, comfortable, with plenty of useful amenities. We had a great stay at Amanda’s place.

Amanda couldn't have been more gracious and accommodating. The apt was exactly what we needed and made for easy access to various parts of the city. St. Henri is a charming and fun neighborhood in it's own right, with lots of great food. All around excellent stay!
The place was clean and the location was good. Easy check in instructions and active communication was very helpful and I enjoyed the stay!

Merci Amanda pour le séjour :)
Mes parents étaient contents du logement et votre disponibilité à répondre aux messages était parfaite. 
Dylan
Great, clean apartment. Exactly as advertised and Amanda was very nice and communicated everything very quickly.

Logement calme et bien placé, les voisins du dessus sont présents de temps en temps et un peu de bruit. Sinon, l'appârt est fonctionnel et bien équipé. Amanda est très réactive aux messages et questions. Je recommande!

reviews.comments: Não tivemos nada a reclamar do local. Apartamento bom e com ótima localização. Porém tivemos um problema, em relação ao horário de entrega e saída que não foi comprido pelo anfitriã. Fomos lesadas ao ter que deixar o local antes do horário combinado e ficamos na rua sem ter para onde ir. Havíamos comprado a passagem de acordo com o que foi combinado. E depois tivemos que sair a pedido da mãe do André ( que nem era ela nossa anfitriã). E se quiséssemos ficar até mais tarde pagaríamos um preço estipulado por ela fora do aplicativo.

name: Little Albion Guest House - Classic
space: The House Delightfully intimate, devastatingly gorgeous, genuinely original & refreshingly unpretentious, Little Albion is the embodiment of the local guest house experience reimagined for the modern luxury traveller.  Behind a beautifully restored heritage former convent lays a world of tantalizing interior delights & surprises awaiting your discovery at every turn.  Your Room  CLASSIC adjective | ˈklæsɪk - judged over a period of time to be of the highest quality and outstanding of its kind.  - of a simple, elegant style.  Welcome to the Classic bedroom at Little Albion.  Located on the third floor, this classic bedroom features striking floral curtains, a red velvet armchair, a beautifully sculpted wooden headboard and a bathroom with walk-in shower. Room size: 20 m2 with King bed

access: As a guest at the Little Albion Guest House you will have access to our 24 hour honour bar, well stocked with a fantastic selection of both Australian and International wines and spirits, as well as complementary tea and coffee through out your stay. Relax in the Oasis of Calm that is the rooftop terrace, which commands breathtaking views over Sydney. In the mornings a light breakfast will be available for you as you plan your day, and here to help you make these plans are our local hosts, whose knowledge of both Surry Hills and Sydney will allow you to get the most out of your time with us.
interaction: 24 hour host service available
house_rules: Pre-payment and cancellations  Pre-payment is required 24 hours prior to arrival (3pm AEST) and will be taken in full on the credit card provided to make your reservation. Any amendments to the reservation need to be made prior to 3pm AEST on the day before arrival. Late cancellations will incur a 1-night cancellation fee. Non arrival (no show reservations) will also incur a 1 night cancellation fee.  All promotional rates (Opening Special, Advance Purchase, Stay and Save) require full pre-payment and hold a non-cancellation policy, are non-refundable and non-transferrable. New Year’s Eve Full pre-payment for reservations over New Year’s Eve 20will be taken at the stage of booking. Any amendments to the booking need to be received by 31st November 2018 in order to avoid a cancellation fee. Any cancellations or amendments after 1st December 2018 will be charged in full.  Arrival & Departure Little Albion welcomes you for check-in from 3pm. Check-out on the day of departure is by 11am. P

host.host_location: Surry Hills, New South Wales, Australia
host.host_about:
Hi, I’m Wendy from Little Albion Guest House
I lead the team of hosts at Little Albion, all of whom have been selected for their genuine love in taking exquisite care of each and every one of our guests' needs and desires. Nothing is too much trouble for us and we delight in going that extra mile to truly make everyone feel like they are staying not in a hotel but in someone's gorgeous home surrounded by the most caring of friends.
We can't wait to share our passion for good old fashioned service and our inside knowledge of all the best spots in eclectic, edgy Surry Hills.
We look forward to your arrival.

reviews.comments: Shared a stay a the Little Albion for work - great location, spacious and super clean rooms, really lovely atmosphere. All in all a lovely experience. Highly recommended

Fast becoming a regular visitor to the Little Albion! A sparkling clean room with detailed amenities, and a friendly stylish ground floor area to do a little work over breakfast before going round the corner to enjoy Surry Hills. Really lovely to spend time with Wendy again, and the fact that everyone knows your name is charming. Looking forward to coming back again soon!

name: Spare Guest Rooms in a Resort-Style House
summary: Gordon is a suburb with history. It has great humanistic and natural environment. Modern 2 storey house set  in a peaceful cul-de-sac with beautiful front and back yard. Walk to Gordon Golf course. Swimming pool, WIFI and lock up garage provided. Bathroom adjacent to the room. 3 minutes drive to Gordon station, 24 hour unlimited carpark at the station and trains to city come every 15 minutes non-peak hour, 3 minutes during peak hour.

Free lock up garage available.  3 minutes drive to Gordon station, 24 hour unlimited carpark at the station and trains to city come every 15 minutes non-peak hour, 3 minutes during peak hour.  Looking For:  Female, couple or university students are preferred. No smoking and no pet due to Athsma - allergy to fur and smell.  Suitable to people who have a car.  No heavy drinker. No party.

reviews.comments: Doris was great, she was very accommodating with when I could check in (11pm) and she responded to my communications in a timely fashion.  They have a beautiful home that I wish I could have taken advantage of more.
Doris is a great host. She went out of her way to make sure we were comfortable and our stay was enjoyable. We liked it so much we are staying again next week.
Doris is a great host.  She made us feel right at home.  The room is lovely and clean and a separate bathroom is available for guests' use.  We enjoyed our stay.

name: Quaint apartment in an excellent location
summary: Our apartment is in the heart of Bellevue Hill. A 20 minute walk from Bondi Beach and Double Bay. A 15 minute walk to Bondi Junction allows you easy access to the rest of Sydney being 25 minutes to the CBD.
description: Our apartment is in the heart of Bellevue Hill. A 20 minute walk from Bondi Beach and Double Bay. A 15 minute walk to Bondi Junction allows you easy access to the rest of Sydney being 25 minutes to the CBD. Bellevue Hill is a quiet but beautiful residential area. The apartment is a short walk from Coopers Park - a beautiful park with wildlife and waterfalls. The apartment is located 100m from cafes, grocery shop and a restaurant. Access to Bondi Beach and the rest of the Eastern Suburbs of Sydney is easy from this great location. The apartment is located 15 minutes walk from Bondi Junction train station and 20 minute walk to Double Bay ferry. If you have a car, there is plenty of street parking available around the apartment. There is no internet available at the apartment.

name: Alexandre Herculano Oporto Residence II
summary: Situado no centro do Porto, o Alexandre Herculano Oporto Residence é um alojamento com acesso a umas vistas deslumbrantes sobre a cidade do Porto. As acomodações possuem ar condicionado, uma casa de banho privativa com chuveiro e produtos de higiene pessoal, assim como uma cozinha totalmente equipada com máquina de lavar e Secar Roupa, forno, micro-ondas, torradeira, cafeteira e chaleira.  O quarto apresenta uma cama de casal e um divã desdobrável (acomodando 3 pessoas),
space: O alojamento destaca-se pelas vistas sobre a cidade, estando localizado no último piso do prédio tendo ao seu dispor uma varanda/terraço  onde é possível relaxar enquanto aprecia o pôr do sol. O apartamento localiza-se na zona centro da cidade do Porto, com restaurantes e bares muito perto, bem como supermercados e farmácias. Os principais monumentos da cidade podem ser visitados a pé dada a proximidade em relação ao alojamento.

name: Nice apt with sea view & balcony
summary: This apartment, located in Póvoa de Varzim, is ideal for 4 vacationers. It offers 2 bedrooms, a balcony and WiFi.
space: This apartment, located in Póvoa de Varzim, is ideal for 4 vacationers. It offers 2 bedrooms, a balcony and WiFi.  The lounge is perfect for unwinding after a day in the sun. Curl up on the comfortable sofa and enjoy a good book or take advantage of the amenities on offer, including WiFi.  The kitchen is well-equipped for cooking up your favorite meals. neighborhood_overview: Located in Porto's historic district, Lolla's Dream House apartment is just a short walk from the emblematic Avenida dos Aliados in the downtown area. The apartment is located in the historic Marquês de Pombal Square. The iconic Clerigos Tower is just a few minutes away, and is next to the Galerias Paris, Porto's main nightlife and bars. The famous Lello Bookstore is also just a few minutes away. The property is also close to the Hard Club, where shows and exhibitions are held regularly. São Bento Station and many other historical landmarks are also in the same area. D. Luís Bridge is 3 km away and connects to the neighboring riverside area of Vila Nova de Gaia, where the Port wine cellars are located.
transit: Marquês Metro Station - 50m Bust Stop - right outside the property Public Parking - Street in front of property

reviews.comments: The host canceled this reservation 8 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

This is a stunning apartment, recently renovated to a very high standard. It's light, stylish and spacious - palatial even! We had all the essentials available to us. I loved that we had coffee, tea and soap miniatures, small details that make a difference. We also had the towels changed and the place cleaned half way through our stay which was unexpected but very welcomed. It felt more like a hotel than an AirBnB. 
The flat overlooks a lovely square, there is a nice coffee shop in it and a beautiful church overlooking. Plenty of super markets nearby and a bakery 2mins away on the edge of the square. Plenty of places nearby for food or drinks. 
The Metro is outside and only 2/3 stops to the most touristy places, we enjoyed walking instead so we could see more of the area. 
Our host met us and took time to explain everything in the flat and surrounding area which is much appreciated. 
This is the nicest AirBnB I've stayed in yet and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it. 
In addition Porto is a very special city, different to Lisbon (which we had got the train from). We loved how unique Porto was and how much it had to offer, wonderful place.
The house is really pretty, you need to be there in person to get a grasp of it. It also has large windows with a view to a park... Highly recommend

reviews.comments:
We enjoyed our stay very much, thanks to great recommendations about things to do. 
The only thing, third bed was a little bit unfomfortable. Besides that the apartment was clean, stylish and with some nice touches. 
Also the location is a huge advantage. Almost everything is within walking distance.

Très bon rapport qualité/prix avec un très bon emplacement. On peut accéder au centre de Porto rapidement. 
Mais ça reste un peu bruyant, ce ne doit pas être du double vitrage. 
Très contente en tout cas.

Experiencia buena. Ubicación excelente. El anfitrión muy atento, la información muy detallada sobre la ciudad. La cama muy cómoda, aunque el sofá - cama algo incómodo y algo ruidoso. Aconsejable llevar tapones. Sin duda repetiriamos sobre todo por la gran amabilidad y disponibilidad de Bruno.
Todo perfecto! relación precio calidad super, la ubicación super.

Appartement très bien situé, à 5 minutes à pied,des restaurants et des commerces,métro.
Notre hôte a été très facile à joindre. Immeuble calme.

Très satisfaits ! La qualité principale de cet appartement est sa situation (centre ville, gares) dont vous pourrez profiter au maximum grâce aux conseils avisés du propriétaire (indications des visites, bonnes adresses, carte détaillée ..). Le lit ainsi que les équipements sont de bonne qualité également. Les points négatifs seraient la douche qui n’est pas très pratique et un peu vétuste et enfin le bruit de la rue en cas de sommeil léger... Parfait pour un petit séjour à Porto et dans ses environs !
Merci pour ce séjour ! L'appartement nous a bien convenu !

Very central location, can be (of course) somewhat noisy during workday mornings.
I definitely recommend this place if you expect a simple  accommodation within few minutes of walk to anywhere you may need. Exactly what you need when staying few nights in Porto.

the cost is not worthwhile for the service that we received. I don't recommend
The house, is really small basically just a room.
The moquette was not clean and full of dust, I'm allergic... 
The bathroom really small as well it was not clean, particulary the shower and the towels.
Bruno asks for extra payment for the check in after 9pm, fro 15 to 30 euro, not written in the description, he says because he has to pay someone to come, that someone was him... When we ask for a receipt he didn't want to give us.
He charged us 50 euro plus for an almost invisible wine stain on the  bedcover, really easy to clean. 
I didn't have a good experience.
apartamento muito bem localizado, ótimas instalações! não é tão barulhento quanto eu esperava. foi bem agradável.

Appartamento centrale, a soli 5 minuti dalla metro ''24 de agosto''. Tutti i posti sono raggiungibili a piedi se amate passeggiare. Bruno è una grande persona..mi ha mostrato la casa e mi ha dato mille consigli sulla città. È stato sempre disponibile rispondendo 24h su 24h. Ci sono tutti i servizi come da descrizione! Bellissima esperienza. Bel posto.Lo Consiglio!
Per me il massimo dei voti all'host! 
Buon viaggio.
Ciao Raff

A great location and a very nice space for the value. A simple, functional and extremely well located studio apartment. The host is always available and very kind also. Its an excellent alternative in a very nice area of Porto.
Very nice place, large windows and lots of light, in a very central location.

address.street: Vila Nova de Gaia, Porto, Portugal

reviews.comments: The Beach Cork Patio was one of my best Airbnb-experiences so far. Since we were one of the first guests of this new location run by the tpc Organisation, the price was extremely low and every item in the little house was brand new. Thy even gave us beach-towles, a volley ball a foot ball, 4 beach-ball rackets and stuff to build sand-castles... the kitchen was brand new and had every thing you need. There was a new coffe-machine, a new microwave, a oven, an induction-cooking-station and every thing else you can imagine. The guy who made the check-in with us was extremely nice and gave us many sight seeing tipps and explained us every thing we needed to know. The garden and the patio ar quite roomy so we could even play football. There is a big table in the garage to pull out for dinner outside. The bathrooms were very clean an roomy, the shower is new. There is a shop (continente) where you can buy every thing you need 850m away and a Cafe/Bar/Bistro were you can buy friesh bread and pastel de nata (must try!) just around the corner. The location is a 20min-Uberdrive away from the city-center (cost for the uber drive was around 10euro). The beach is 5min walk away and very clean and calm. The only little downside were the dogs in the neighbourhood barking the hole night... every thing else was absolutely perfect!

Casa bien situada al lado de la playa, en una zona tranquila. Carril para bicicletas muy próximo: puedes ir hasta Porto en bicicleta. Espacio de aparcamiento en el patio para dos coches. Estancia muy agradable. Tiene ventiladores en las habitaciones. Buen equipamiento.

Bonita casa, muy bien equipada, situada muy cerquita de la playa. Detalles como hamacas y toallas para ir a la playa y juegos para los que van con niños. La localización excelente. Vila Nova de Gaia con mas de 15 kms. de playas, con senderos de madera a lo largo de todas ellas, con un monton de chiringuitos en los que se puede comer a precios muy asequibles  y con un transporte publico organizado muy bien para poder visitar Oporto, es un sitio inmejorable para pasar unas muy buenas vacaciones.

The apartment has a perfect location if you want to visit Porto but also spend some time at the beach. It includes a parking spot which is convenient especially because Porto is a 20 minute drive away. All in all, the flat lived up to our expectations. It gets a bit loud at night sometimes because there are some noisy dogs in the neighborhood. Our host welcomed us on time and was ready to answer any questions.
Si quieres pasar unos dias de tranquilidad y al lado de la playa este esta es tu casita.
la casa es perfecta. Muy recomendable

Casimiro house is very well located next to some of the nicest beaches of the area. There are restaurants and a lot of places to have breakfast, lunch or dinner and the sunset is worth it! Porto is only a few minutes away by car. The house kitchen is very well equipped and the bedroom are small but well equipped with large cupboards. Two bathrooms make it easier when 6 people have to get their shower. Bed were done and we all received two towels per person (small + big one) + beach towels. If the weather is nice, you can also enjoy the space in front of the house, private area with a table and chairs, well arranged. Very good wifi available for free. There is no heating (as in most of the house in Portugal...), so if you go when the weather may be colder, bring some warm cloths for the night. We had a good stay in this house. Thanks.
Sehr nett & schön! Sehr nah am Strand und an der Stadt :)

Cette maison est idéalement située. Elle est très bien équipée (nécessaire pour cuisiner, dosettes de lessive pour machine à laver, dosette pour lave vaisselle, des sèche cheveux dans chaque salle de bains, la tv, le wifi...). L'accueil et la gestion de la location sont assurés par "The Porto Concierge", société qui met tout en oeuvre pour vous sentir bien, équipe sympathique chaleureuse et disponible. Je ne manquerai pas de me rapprocher d elle lors de mon prochain séjour et ce, les yeux fermés. Merci à tous pour le partage de votre culture !
En hiver une catastrophe

reviews.comments:
We had a pleasant stay in Eren’s apartment. It is very well located – really close to the metro and bus station and to the ferry (about 5 minutes from the door) – you can easily reach all the important tourist sites in just few minutes by metro or by boat. (We highly recommend you to take a boat – it takes about 20-30 minutes to Eminonu – Sultanahmet or to Karakoy – Galata – and see the city from the Bosphorus.) In the neighbourhood of the apartment you can find everything you need – shops, restaurants, bars, cafes (local Turkish and also Starbucks) and services etc. 
We met Eren the first day we arrived. We did not need any special help or advices, as it was not our first visit to Instanbul, but Eren was constanly within reach on the phone, willing to help or advise all the time. There is no reason not to believe him. In all cases, he responded very quickly on all our messages.
We should note that people with very light sleep could be disturbed by the disco which is somewhere in the quarter, which can be heard in some days in the front room. Otherwise the apartment is very quiet.
We appreciated the balcony – it is a great place to unwind after a long day or to take a breakfast.
Anyway, we definitely recommend a stay at Eren’s place and we will be happy to return if we have an opportunity to do so.

My friends and me enjoyed the stay at Eren’s place a lot. It’s a big and charming apartment on the top floor with a cool balcony. Beside the spacious living room there are two bedrooms, which makes the apartment perfect for bigger groups or two couples. In the fridge there were also fresh vegetables, eggs, coffee, tea, etc. for breakfast – thanks!
Kadiköy is an interesting, lively and charming neighborhood of Istanbul (actually my  favorite one). The location of the apartment is just perfect: 5 min to all kinds of transport (ferry, metro,..), next to the market/bazar, nice restaurants and bars and close to the charming neighborhood of Moda!
The communication with Eren was really easy. He was very helpful and also patient with us – our ferry had a 9 hours delay and we couldn’t even inform him, as far as there was no connection on the sea. 
Thanks Eren for everything!

We are happy that we stayed in this place!Great location(in the the center of Kadikoy),really friendly host.Near from home are located bus station,port and metro.Also you can visit bazar,where you can find pretty interesting cafe(eat some fish or maybe pasta).We liked it,so thank you)

Amazing location in the very center on Kadikoy and very close to the sea., all shops and restaurants are just downstairs, the apartment and balcony space were very satisfying and Eren and his friend who welcomed us with a big smile was something special!
Only air conditioning and 5th floor stairs were a bit annoying but honestly it was a great value and a great stay despite anything else :)

We had a great stay at this flat! It is really nice and spacious, and the balcony is super chill. We could only stay for two nights, but I wouldn't have minded staying a week! The location is really good, and there's great atmosphere all around. Others had noted the lack of airco - but even though we were there during hot August days, the height of the flat and its amazing balcony brought in a nice breeze - and the fan did the rest. Flights of stairs no issue even with my 20kg bag. Recommend this place!
Everything with Eren was expected and the stay was nice. Thank you

Thanks to the hosts we had a great time in Istanbul. Eren and his roommate were superb hosts and went out of their way to ensure that we have a great time. The apartment is perfectly located in the centre of Kadiköy and has a beautiful balcony to relax on :)

Eren è stato gentilissimo, ci ha aiutato a portare i bagagli in casa (l’appartamento si trova al 4 piano senza ascensore) e ci ha mostrato in ogni dettaglio la casa. 
C’è una stanza con un letto da una piazza e mezza e un’altra stanza NON con un letto matrimoniale ma un materasso matrimoniale semplicemente messo a terra. Non è il massimo per la schiena se siete lì per lavoro e avete bisogno di comodità o di riposare. Ci sono almeno un paio di divani letto in soggiorno, comunque. 
Non esistono armadi guardaroba di alcun tipo. Abbiamo chiesto qualche gruccia per appendere almeno gli abiti alle porte, ma a quanto pare sono di difficile reperibilità.
Bisogna un po’ arrangiarsi.

L’appartamento, ad ogni modo, si trova in una bellissima zona di Istanbul, colorata e molto viva, troverete dove mangiare e supermercati in quantità.
Eren samimi bir ev sahibi. Sizin ne istediginize bagli olarak ev butun ihtiyaclarini karsilayabilir degerde.
very good location and very easy communication with Eren!
Perfectly located for full enjoyment of Istanbul - near ferries, buses, tram, fantastic area filled with restaurants and gorgeous fresh produce, plenty of bars and nightlife. Highly recommend.

Dear, Eren!
Thank you for your hospitality. We had comfortable and pleasant stay at your apartment.
Halyna

Nice appartment, well located near public tranportations (vapur and metro/tram).
Eren is very helpful.

name: Hamakua Hideaway Cliff House
summary: At the heart of Hawaii is a lush tropical paradise beyond compare. The Cliffhouse is a custom built cottage, overlooking the majestic Waipio Valley. Nestled into a bamboo forest, completely emersed in a garden of flowers. Includes fireplace & jacuzzi
space: Tucked away in a hidden paradise, we offer our charming cottage. Immersed in a plethora of plants, flowers, and amazing views, it is the perfect "get-away" spot. You'll find yourself situated on the cliffs above the majestic Waipio Bay. From the home, you have wide open views of the Kohala Cliffs, a 17 mile view up the coast to Pololu Point, and a 50 mile view across the sea to the Beautiful island of Maui. We are proud to be able to share a bit of "Old Hawai'i" with our beautiful hidden oasis. The home is private. The home is equipped with WIFI, a DVD plaver and a flat screen TV. There is a covered carport connected to the cottage, there are three covered long (very minimal incline) steps that lead from carport to the front porch. The home has a  big Jacuzzi tub with views of the Ocean and Maui. The cottage has a big yard and there are lovely garden areas with flowers, herbs and fruit trees. There is also a two person swing to enjoy. We offer complete privacy in this tropical paradise
description: At the heart of Hawaii is a lush tropical paradise beyond compare. The Cliffhouse is a custom built cottage, overlooking the majestic Waipio Valley. Nestled into a bamboo forest, completely emersed in a garden of flowers. Includes fireplace & jacuzzi Tucked away in a hidden paradise, we offer our charming cottage. Immersed in a plethora of plants, flowers, and amazing views, it is the perfect "get-away" spot. You'll find yourself situated on the cliffs above the majestic Waipio Bay. From the home, you have wide open views of the Kohala Cliffs, a 17 mile view up the coast to Pololu Point, and a 50 mile view across the sea to the Beautiful island of Maui. We are proud to be able to share a bit of "Old Hawai'i" with our beautiful hidden oasis. The home is private. The home is equipped with WIFI, a DVD plaver and a flat screen TV. There is a covered carport connected to the cottage, there are three covered long (very minimal incline) steps that lead from carport to the front porch. The hom
neighborhood_overview: The cottage is centrally located between Hilo and Kona. Conveniently located near ATV tours, Horsebacking, Ziplining, Hiking Tours, Helicopter tours and other fun activities. There are many great "must see" businesses in the area such as the "Hamakua Mushroom farm", producing amazing specialty Mushrooms, The Paul Mitchell's "Awapuhi" farm growing awaphui gingers for silky shampoo, or "Hawaii Vanilla Company" which just happens to be the only producing vanilla farm in the US. Our charming one street historic town of Honokaa is a must see as well. Don't forget to spend a day exploring the Valley!
access: Renting a 4x4 jeep can allow you to get to special places like the short 4x4 only road down to the black sand beach in Waipio Valley, over to the green sand beach and up to the summit of Mauna Kea. Even if you don't get a 4x4, a rental car will still get you everywhere you need to go. From the Cliffhouse there are lots of hiking opportunities as well.
house_rules: The fireplace is very safe but always practice caution  Remember to put out all candles you light  Ladder to loft is easy and safe but practice safety

host.host_about: My name is Kristan. I started the Hamakua Hideaway in 1986. It is my joy to read about how the Cliff House has inspired people to be and feel their best. I take great pride in providing as much beauty and peace as possible, so that people can rejuvenate and go back to their world with an expanded awareness. The garden is totally organic. The beds have organic sheets and I use only nontoxic cleaning supplies. I grow flowers, herbs and fruit trees.

reviews.comments: What a magical space you have, thanks for all the little details and work that you clearly put in to make this place so special.  So comfortable and beautiful!!!

The cliff house itself and the view combined make this place one of my absolute favorites ever!! What a delightful, private, breathtaking, and perfectly situated cottage with incredible charm and a perfect layout.  I can't recommend this place enough.  Kristan has created a rare to find, true sanctuary.  

I didn't get to meet Kristan until serendipitously right as I was leaving, and was glad to meet the person who put so much into creating such a special place.  We had a brief, sweet exchange.

Thanks, Kristan!!  I will be back!

Such an amazing surprise! Beautiful view, comfortable beds, this place was perfect. And walking distance from where our horseback day trip met in the morning. I'll make sure to tell other travelers about this gem.

We were so lucky to have been able to stay at such a wonderful place.  Thank you Kristan for sharing your beautiful house and we could not think of a better place to base ourselves for a few days exploring the Big Island.  If you are after pure serenity and surrounded by stunning scenery, you will find it hard to beat this place... it truly is amazing!  Every minute of our stay was so enjoyable and Kristan was an absolute pleasure to deal with.  Thanks again and we would be back tomorrow if we could.

A postcard setting!!!! It was easy to find... Breathtaking views, positive energy, comfortable, clean, open, and spacious!! Loved the robes, our morning coffee on the patio, the giant bed and above all, a restful...quiet sleep! We loved your welcoming note ... Made us feel at home!!

We will be back!!

Mahalo

Our experience was one to remember!  The views were breathtaking, the garden and house were put together with such love and care, and the quaint town nearby was full of the charm of the Aloha spirit. My favorite part was waking up to the spectacular scenery, having coffee with Lani, and taking pictures of the cliffs and garden so that I could remind myself of what heaven on Earth looks like.  This hideaway is quite the gem, and I hope to return one day. The orchids were plentiful, the pleasant sounds of nature never ceased to amaze me, and the unique treasures within the home truly gave us an authentically local experience.  The cliff house has everything you need, and will not disappoint.  Mahalo!

We had a wonderful time at the Hideaway Cliffhouse. The location is spectacular and the cozy, charming house is just perfect for a couple or couple with kids. Kristan has filled the place with personal touches that create atmosphere and warmth - so different than a neutral hotel room.

Wonderful place to stay. Amazing view. The house has a lot of lovely details which gives it charactar and a nice atmosphere to live there. Very private and peacful spot. We had a wonderful time. Thank you

Unbelievably beautiful spot!!  View is tremendous and better than advertised.  Hard to tell how spectacular it is from the photos.  We had a very relaxing weekend at the cottage.  It was neat and clean, tucked away among flowers, trees, birds, and frogs on a lush, undeveloped part of the island right near Waipio Valley.  Thanks Kristan.

The pictures truly don't do this place justice. It's breathtaking, unique and an experience not to be missed. You go to bed hearing sounds of nature, and wake up with one of the most spectacular views we've seen.
If you're in this area of Hawaii, check that...anywhere within a 500 miles radius, you must stay here, it is amazing. When you look out on the view you'll think you're dreaming.

This place is perfect it's quiet and private with an exceptional view. It's a very  open and comfortable floor plan with lots of air flow which we loved. My GF and I stayed here for 8 nights and it was exactly what we wanted.
Gorgeous hideaway with a stunning view! High up on a cliff the photos don't do this place justice. There is even herbs growing in the garden. Beautiful tropical plants. Cosy and cute retreat.
Great view. Clean facility. Very private.  Would like to have met host.
The Paradise itself! With the view, the house, the garden..the beauties can not be described!
The reservation was canceled the day before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Our stay was not long enough.  From the moment you step into the space your jaw drops.  The house was small but the view from every window made up for it, and the house had a wonderful Hawaiian feel.  Looking forward to returning to the private hideaway

From entering the door to pulling ourselves away,  the love in this place is tangible and abundant.   The view is as magical as described by other reviewers.    We live above Kealakekua Bay on the other side of the island and have a million dollar view.   This is three times that.   The  hale is quirky and interesting.   We are 2 middle age couples and were perfectly comfortable.
This place is just perfect to stay in Hawaii !!Everything is beautiful and peaceful... I definitely come back!

Kristan's hideaway is breathtaking. Its absolutely beautiful and completely secluded with stunning views yet has all the amenities of a deluxe rental. 
I would recommend arriving during daylight hours, we had a little trouble finding the spot because we were looking for it at 10pm. There are also 2 dogs and a cat that hang out in the area, all of which are super affectionate, so getting in and out of the hideaway requires a stop to attend to them. Thank you for hosting us!

If getting engaged at the Private Hawaiian Hideaway cliff house house isn't enough indication of how much my fiancee and I enjoyed our time then let me just (Website hidden by Airbnb) was amazing! The view of the Waipio Valley from the cliff house is breathtaking and the house is beautiful and well appointed. The hideaway is only 25 minutes from the town of Honokaa where you can buy groceries and get gas. You can walk to the Waipio look out and there is a decent hike or drive down to the black sand beaches. I highly recommend the hike...its a unique and beautiful place. I would recommend this place to anyone who wants a romantic and unique experience on the big island. We will be back!
Words really can't describe our extraordinary experience at the gorgeous cliff house. This truly special gem will be a place we return to for many years to come.

We had an amazing stay @ Kristan's Cliffhouse.  It truly is a hideaway with amazing views.  The pictures do not fully do this place justice!  The cliffhouse itself is gorgeous and very comfortable for 2 people, with plenty of amenities incl a full kitchen and a nice jacuzzi tub.   
Kristan was great to deal with and was very prompt in responding to our questions before our arrival. 
A great experience and we will definitely stay here again the next time we are on the Big Island!

It was really hard to leave Kristan's place.  We wanted quiet privacy and that's exactly what we got. The place is stunning. We loved everything about it. The sounds of the hidden waterfall, the night time chorus of nature, not to mention the amazing whale watching in the mornings while sipping coffee. The bed was very comfortable and the island breeze at night made for a very restful stay. I would like to mention that Kristan gave exact directions that would have made it very easy for us to find the house. However, I didn't print them out thinking I would have cell service and would able to rely on my phone. BE SURE YOU PRINT Kristan's directions before your stay. When she says Private Hideaway she means it.
We're so grateful to Kristan for making our vacation one to remember!! MAHALO!

This hideaway may simply be one of the most beautiful places on earth. The view never gets old, the gardens are lush, the house is artfully designed, and the tub room is an added treat. I recommend that anyone stay here if given the opportunity.

The Hideaway Cliffhouse is truly a dream come true.  We were enchanted with the experience from the moment we drove onto the property.  The views are spectacular and the energy of the place is so healing.

We had a great stay here. Kristan's directions were clear and we had no problem finding this beautiful, remote location. Everything is as described. The view is amazing and the house is absolutely charming. Great sit-out and swing for outdoors, and cozy house with fireplace and jacuzzi-tub. Its well maintained and a very inviting space. We'd certainly stay here again.
We thought this was the most amazing place we could ever stay.  So well appointed and private. We can't wait to come back.
Fabulous home, fabulous host, fabulous stay! We enjoyed connecting to nature in this gorgeous secluded hideaway. Quaint town just 8 miles up. Our experience was fantastic!

We came looking for a serene place, and found paradise. The view, the cottage, the garden -- everything was spectacularly perfect and unforgettable. We spent hours looking at the view of the cliffs and sea with an occasional glimpse of Maui on the horizon.  Thank you Kristan for creating such a wonderful and unique place and for sharing it with us.

Absolutely hypnotic view from the coziness of the couch, the bed, the bathtub, anywhere, really.  Kitchen is stocked with just about everything we needed.  Our Host Kristan was very gracious, and directions were well laid out.    A wonderful visit.
You gotta feel this house, totally amazing experience, surrounded by true Hawaiian nature!
This place is fantastic and magical!  The view can't be beat.  The pictures don't do it justice.

The view is what makes this a special place; there are indeed few places in the world that boast such an impressive amenity.  The yard's botanical features are also beautiful and diverse.  

Mosquitoes galore, so make sure to bring repellant, and the housing was adequate, if a bit damp from humidity.  Also not a lot to do in the area except look at the view, which, once again, was undeniably exceptional.

Pictures do not do this hideaway Justice. It was so peaceful and relaxing listening to the sounds birds, crashing water and a near by waterfall. The views were absolutely breathtaking - it's was very hard to leave this place. Kirsten had thought of everything - candles, and ear plugs (if people can't take the sound at night) 
I especially loved how the house was so open to the environment surrounding the house.

This place is AMAZING!!! Our stay was much too short. If you are booking a shuttle into the valley (highly recommended) you could use the Waipio Valley Shuttle & Tours....its in the same building as Waipio Valley Artworks which is literally 2-3 minutes from this cottage. Everything was exactly as described. VERY clean, tucked away, private, with an absolutely incredible view. We would absolutely stay here again. We found the cottage before dark but if you can't you will have a pretty difficult time due to the location. We didn't have any AT&T service which wasn't a problem for us. There is wifi though once you get there. We printed the directions to the cottage like Kristan suggested and that was extremely helpful. Perfect place to stay after a long day in the valley.

Très bel environnement, vue magnifique sur la baie de Waipio, maison très confortable et parfaitement équipée, séjour idyllique.
Nous aurions aimé rencontrer Kristan.
The host canceled this reservation 2 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Amazing house breathtaking views! Easy and delightful! We will be back!
The host canceled this reservation 8 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
This place was incredible, wish I was there right now.  Perfect romantic hideaway.

Charming house with an outstanding view. In a lovely tropical garden. An amazing place to rest and enjoy waipu valley.
The house is very nicely furnished  and decorated in a shabby chic style.with many  interesting books on hawaii
Just be aware that this part of the island can be humid with mosquitoes

The Hideaway House is a dream. It was the perfect place for us to stay, and we enjoyed it immensely. Kristan is one of a kind! Her 11am check out time is firm, so make sure you're ready to go (11am snuck up on me, so I was about 30 minutes behind- sorry Kristan!)

We loved having lizard friends around the house- they made us smile and we named all of them. Kristan's son (I think) also has a very sweet dog who is occasionally around. The dog is kind and respectful and I think just likes to know that you are as happy as she is. 
I loved the abundance of fruit everywhere! We ate so much fruit around town. 

Our favorite places were: Sea Cucumber and Hina Rae's for brunch/lunch in Honokaa, Waipi'o beach for a GNARLY hike with a great reward at the bottom, and Hapuna Beach (clear on the other side of the island, but a great drive!)

Our stay at the Hamakua Hideaway Cliff House was truly extraordinary.  When booking the Cliff House, I thought the pictures of the place and its view had to be too good to be true, but I was very pleasantly surprised to find that the pictures actually don't do justice to how incredible the view is from the Cliff House.  This is the ideal place for anyone looking for a quiet, rejuvenating stay on the Big Island, with the perfect balance between modern luxuries and exposure to Hawaii's gorgeous natural landscapes.  I would love to stay here again.

This really is a cabin that let's you feel like you're part of nature, but with modern comforts. Incredible views, gorgeous garden and great, private location. Decorated with care, with lots of unique details. Mosquitoes did manage to find their way in, perhaps because we weren't careful enough with the door when we first arrived, and it does get a bit humid/damp.
A beautiful location and a very well looked after and well loved bluff-top cottage. If you can take your eyes off the view you'll see the accommodations are equally impressive.

The Hamakua Hideaway Cliff House was absolutely wonderful. The space is charming and romantic, the setting and view are dreamy and magical. You can see and feel the love and care here, from the manicured tropical landscaping (neat, wild, and lush), to the hand-carved bench and attention to detail. Definitely a must for a romantic getaway!
Amazing!

Kristen! Thank you so much for having such a beautiful place open for reservations. My husband and I had an incredible time staying in your lovely place and exploring the surrounding area.  We absolutely fell in love with the scenery and with the cute, beautiful cottage. Overall we loved every minute of it!! thank you again for having us as guests in your lovely cottage :)

Hamakua Hideaway is amazing! The views are truly breathtaking. We spent 2 nights here while traveling around the Big Island and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Kristan has thought of every little detail to make this place special.  The location is private (very close Waipi'o Valley overlook) but just a short drive to the town of Honoka'a which has a grocery store and several restaurants. Of note, I would recommend a 4 wheel drive vehicle because the driveway is a little steep.

Kristan's house is amazing!! It was the first night of our wedding week and we could not have chosen better. Her home is full of soul and calm energy. Everything we needed to know was left written down on the table, easy. Her garden is lush and vibrant and the view is amazing! We were so happy to spend time there. Thank you Kristan!!

3 words - magical, heavenly, and nothing like it in this world. This has to be one of the top 10 airbnbs in the world!! Thank you Kristan for letting us stay here. My gf and I had the most wonderful time, we will definitely come back next time we are on the Big Island, hopefully this will still be available. Mahalo!

Kristan's Hamakua Hideaway Cliff House is a delightful little dream palace in the clouds. We arrived and were dumbstruck by the beauty of the view and the garden that frames it. It's perched above Waipio Valley, maybe one of the most beautiful places on earth, and it's situated so that you can take it all in from the garden, if the weather is nice, or from inside, if it's raining.  The weather seems to constantly shift in the valley, which only makes sense, since it is a rainforest. But that made the experience all the more interesting.  Travelers should take note that since it *is* in the middle of a rainforest, it can get pretty damp inside. Bugspray is a must if you're going to sit outside. Maybe the single best view from the house is from the tub in the screened-in bathroom—you should absolutely take a bath and watch the sunset.  The water takes a while to get warm, but it does get there.  

Transportation-wise, we debated whether we needed a Jeep or not. You *don't* need a Jeep to get to the house, but to get down into the valley itself—which you absolutely must do—you must have 4WD or otherwise very sturdy walking shoes and a lot of ambition. It's a long steep walk back up.  (We opted to get the Jeep.)  

The house is more cabin-in-the-woods than it is a luxury cabana, so come in the spirit of being thrust into beautiful and rugged nature, and you won't be disappointed. It's a truly special spot.

It was great place with amazing view!

If you follow the direction from the owner, you will find the place smoothly. Don't follow (Hidden by Airbnb) map!

My husband and I usually go the "Kona resort route" when we visit the big island, but this time we wanted to experience Hawaii in a different, more natural way.  We definitely hit the jackpot with this charming Hamakua Hideaway!  Nestled in tall bamboo and lush green vegetation, we felt we had total privacy  -- and the only sounds were the birds, occasional rainfall, and frogs, frogs, frogs (the nocturnal kind)! It was exactly what I -- a city person --  would imagine living in the midst of the Amazon rainforest would be like (minus the snakes).  :)  Of course the magnificent view from this Waipio rim location must certainly be among the best in the area (the photo is exactly as it is).  Although we did not have the pleasure of meeting Kristan, we did randomly connect with Scotty, the friendly caretaker, so help was nearby if needed.  Thank you for this most unique "jungle" experience and many very special anniversary memories!
This was an amazing place to relax. We would definitely come back!!!

How do you describe paradise? This house was everything we had hoped for. A true hideaway in the jungle. I don't know how many times we looked at each other and said, "Wow!" I've never seen anything like it. Thank you so much for sharing your home. What an amazing place. 100 stars!

What amazing memories we brought home. The couple of nights we stayed at this rustic and cozy hideaway were incredible.  We couldn't stop taking photos of the breath-taking views and botanical-like garden with every kind of tropical flower you can think of. The amenities were very nice and we found it to be very clean.  We'll return for sure!

Host was very accommodating but unseen, and that's not a criticism, it just made the experience that much more private and serene.  Neighbors are virtually invisible, though there was one memorable visit from a hyper-enthusiastic, friendly, overjoyed to be petted, but utterly-silent white dog, who vanished just as she had appeared, like a ninja.  

This place is about views and sound.  An unseen rush of water cascades through the verdant chasm, the soundtrack for the 'living photograph' views of the mouth of Waipio and coastline beyond.  In rainy weather, only with some difficulty and potential danger might you catch a glimpse of this torrent, a churning chocolate upstream, and only your ears telling you that it has turned to a waterfall somewhere below you, pounding down somewhere in the distance below the swinging love-seat outside the entry.  I found myself mesmerized by view and sound, with any number of similar waterfalls visible in the distance across Waipio.

We realized soon after arriving that, unlike with most hotel accommodations, there needn't be any guilt or regrets for finding a lazy minimal-travel schedule that allows one to STAY here and enjoy the place.  Shop for food to stash enroute if possible, and bring at least your breakfast selections.  Cook anything you like in the well-appointed, small but elegant kitchen...which also has That View...

We chose the Ciffhouse as our third and final stop for a week-long visit and the site of our little wedding on the Big Island. The bright and cheerful cottage was a memorable perch for our two-day stay. It's an older property, somewhat rustic, but well-mainained, so adjust your expectations accordingly (and be Ok with the geckos, inside and out, and bring mosquito repellant). The bed is comfortable, the kitchen has been updated, and though the shower is small, it has good water pressure. The proximity to Waipio Valley cannot be beat. Although we had 4WD, we chose to walk down to the valley floor/black sand beach, and highly recommend that over driving, which seemed dangerous and risky for the inexperienced. We were completely taken by the grandeur of waking up this view and watching the sun wash over the 2000 ft cliffs. And equally enamored with drifting off to sleep alongside the symphony of rainforest frogs outside. I appreciate that there is no additional cleaning fee or taxes--it's all included in the $250 nightly rate. More than any other place we stayed, the Cliffhouse and Honokaa/Kukuihaele is less touristy and nestled among local residents. Parts of the neighborhood seem economically depressed and the sight of chained up dogs was heart-wrenching to us as animal lovers. But having the property owner's friendly cat and dog visit us was delightful and comforting. Our cell phones did not work at all for calls, but there IS wifi, thus emails and texts can be sent and received, if more slowly than your used to. Definitely arrive during daylight hours. Though the instructions provided were spot on, the cliff house is tucked away and the area is very dark at night. We loved our time there and hope to return on a special anniversary.
Great experience

The cliff house is a really hidden place. As soon as you step on the porch there is a stunning view of the cliffs and the bay! It is very remote and quiet there, bur when the night fall a thousand frogs start to squeak, it is amazing. Do not miss the watch the stars at nights, they are so clear and bright - just fantastic!

We stayed here for the second part of our trip; first five days near Kailua and four nights here.  It was such a welcome change in scenery from black lava to lush rainforest.  

The house is a charming private retreat where you can really get away from it all.  I really enjoyed the jungle come alive at night. it's actually quite loud!  Every night my husband and I established a relaxing routine after dinner: 1) draw a soothing jacuzzi bath, 2) drink wine on the porch embracing the stunning waipio valley, and 3) fall asleep by the warm glowing fireplace in peace and serenity.  Four nights like that make you never ever want to leave.  

The bonus were our daily visits from the neighbors dogs and cat. They are the absolute sweetest dogs!   One of them likes to bark a bit at first to say hi but don't be alarmed :)

There were only a couple drawbacks; mosquitoes are inevitable here and they will inevitably get inside no matter how careful you are with the door.  My husband and I are prone to be bitten so Unfortunately we were bitten a number of times; I started to get a bit paranoid about it but you basically should just cover up at all times - especially when you go to sleep. 

Also this is isn't really a cooking kitchen and there no microwave with limited cooking accessories. So id recommend cooking simple meals.  There's good places to eat for dinner 25 min away in Waimea.  And there malama market in honokaa. You can get a duraflame log there (if it doesn't run out) for the fireplace.  The logs that are on the property are too wet and won't light.  

Enjoy!
We liked the house and especially the perfect view from the cliffs. You can even see the whales from this point if you are lucky enough

The place was fantastic! As incredible as it sounds, the pictures don't do the view justice. We were in awe every morning. My wife and I came here on our honeymoon and loved it. 

The place has 2 beds (1 of them is in a nice little loft), a usable kitchen, and is perfect for 2-4 people. The garden and area surrounding the place is a destination in itself! It's very close to the Waipio Valley and walking distance to a great breakfast place called Waipio cook house. We loved it would recommend this place to anyone!

A wonderful house with awesome view to the sea. You can do wale watching from the garden...its amazing. 
The place is very private and you can really enjoy relaxing time. We felt in love with little Kitty and got visited every day. As we have two cats at home it makes us more feeling welcome with our little guest....
The dogs and the little puppies were a plus on top for us. It was so nice and we can just highly recommend everything.
The contact to owner and the preparation of information package was perfect. Thanks a lot for a wonderful time in you nice house.

The host was very helpful with directions. We did not see here at all, but when we had a question we called and she helped us right away.
The house is beautiful, and very comfortable, in the most beautiful location and view possible. The tub facing out over the cliffs and the ocean is extraordinary. The kitchen is well equipped.
Kristen had an amazing amount and selection of reading material. Alot of information on Hawaii. Just do not arrive at night, because it is hard to find in the dark. I only wish we could have stayed longer

Our stay at the Cliff House was the exclamation point to our fabulous visit to the Big Island! Although not met in person,  Kristan's presence was felt and appreciated in her amazing attention to detail and feng shui.  Not only clean, well equipped, peaceful, exquisitely decorated and located...This is a hostess who has created something VERY special and enjoys sharing it!  From the moment we arrived at the Hideaway it felt like the welcoming embrace of a dearly loved friend.  Add to that the stunning vista of the coastline and surrounding garden.  We had our own private front seat window to the beauty of the ocean and open sky...watched whales cavort and a waterfall appear from the cliffside after a rain! If you have the opportunity to stay here we are fully confident that you will feel as lucky and as grateful as we are!
Mahalo Kristan...from the bottom of our hearts!

I don't know where to begin! The most beautiful place we have ever had the pleasure of staying. Not only is the view astounding, the home itself is adorable. The grounds are carefully landscapes with so much interesting and gorgeous plant life. Especially loved taking baths in the jacuzzi tub at sunset, with huge windows overlooking the sea and mountains. The cabin has lovely woodwork and details. Such a dream. I could go on and on. We didn't want to leave. Can't believe this place is real. The best Airbnb ever.

If you're fortunate enough to stumble upon this listing and it's available, consider it a true blessing and do not pass it up. My husband and I spent two nights of our week long honeymoon here and couldn't have asked for a more perfect experience. Kristan is an angel for sharing her piece of paradise with the Airbnb community. You aren't too far from town, but we chose to do our grocery shopping on our way and prepared most meals at her place. It's a simple but stocked kitchen with everything you need. I'm a NYC chef, so believe me when I say it has everything you'll need. French press and coffee maker, blender, tea pot, water purifier, etc. we loved the jacuzzi tub overlooking the ocean. Words and photos fall short in a huge way when trying to describe this place. Thank you Kristan! And the dogs! Perfection!
The most dramatic view of any place I have stayed.  Very remote, and unfortunately the valley was closed to hikers due to dengue when I visited.

The accommodations and the view were absolutely stunning. You can hear the waterfall, the flowers are beautiful, and the bathtub room is something that would be $100/hour minimum at a spa. We're pet people, so we were happy to see friendly animals when we arrived, but heads up for anyone with pet allergies- the cat has a sense of entitlement to the house. Also, 3 of the dogs are very sweet and friendly (although if you try to give them food they may start fighting), but one other dog, who was either stray or had recently had puppies, was snarling and posturing very aggressively, and followed us into the driveway. I'm a ranch kid, I've been around animals my whole life, and I can clearly see when a dog is potentially aggressive vs. just barking defensively... and I didn't feel comfortable approaching this dog at all. I understand that the property is on the rural side and that means a relaxed attitude toward keeping pets confined, which I'm actually used to and don't mind at all- but the presence of an aggressive dog is not appropriate for a vacation rental. If I were the type of person who was just scared and tried to run from the dog, I'm quite sure it would've chased me. It continued to snarl and move toward me even after I clapped loudly at it and yelled at it to go home. It didn't back off until I started kicking gravel from the driveway at it. I would've called the host to ask her to come deal with it, but unfortunately she was unresponsive through our 2 day stay. I left her a voicemail and called several times the day of our checkin, and I'm back on the mainland now and she still hasn't called me back. I'm new to Airbnb, this vacation was the first time we've ever used it, and I had just been checking my email for correspondence rather than opening the Airbnb app- turns out there were several messages I hadn't seen, including one from our host that contained all the details of our checkin. It was my fault for not checking the messages via the app, but on the day of our checkin we weren't quite sure what the procedure was going to be, and when I called the host, her phone went straight to voicemail every time. So... All that having been said, I'd still highly recommend this place to a friend, provided that the aggressive dog issue is dealt with. The location is absolutely breathtaking, the accommodations are very comfortable, and the full kitchen was great (don't mind the geckos, they run when you get close.) We love to cook and the big island has some of the best produce you'll find anywhere on earth. And the other 3 dogs really were super adorable, they would wait outside our door with their tails wagging, but were trained not to come in the house. It was definitely an experience...

The view is real and even better than the pictures can capture. We loved this cabin on the cliff and its lush, scenic surroundings. Close to Waipio Valley with easy access to tours it still made us feel completely relaxed and alone as it is tucked between trees and a cliff overlooking the ocean. We felt at home instantly.

All I can say is WOW--- This place is truly amazing...a hidden gem. It is hard to put into words what makes it so great- you have to stay here to see what it's all about! The Hideaway was definitely our favorite stop on the Big Island- 2 nights here just wasn't enough! The house is close to town (Honoka'a) where you can buy groceries/visit shops and restaurants and is a very short drive (or walk) to Waipi'o Valley. We preferred to make our meals here as the view so beautiful and the house so comfortable you won't want to leave :)
My wife and I loved staying at the Cliff House.  The view is spectacular and the house and the grounds are beautiful.  We'd highly recommend staying here.

The view is breathtaking.  As we walked into the home, it felt like we were in a movie -- so cozy, cute and vacation-like.  We took full advantage of the outdoor swing, tub (with amazing view) and porch (had coffee there each morning).  It's the perfect retreat!  Location-wise we were a .3 mile drive to the Waipio lookout for a beautiful hike. Cell service can be spotty depending on your carrier (Kristan let us know that ahead of time), for the most part wifi worked fine.  Kristan was very responsive in giving us directions and recommendations for grocery stores.  The only thing we would have loved to see is maybe a little binder with info on the house (e.g. instructions for working the fire place and oven).  Overall an amazing time, would highly recommend!

The Hamakua Hideaway Cliff House was one of the most spectacular places I've had the pleasure of Airbnbing. From the 2 person jacuzzi, to the wonderful kitchen, to the amazing views of the coastline and Waipio Valley, this one of a kind cottage was truly something special. With directions in hand, the place is easily found, and you will soon discover the beautiful gardens and breathtaking views as you look around the grounds. Within a hour's drive from some excellent beaches and only a short distance from hiking and other activities, this spot is definitely one to book if you have the opportunity. Host was helpful with anything we asked, which wasn't much. Keep in mind cellphone service is little to nothing, but the internet works great! Thank you Kristan for the hospitality!

The Cliff House was everything advertised and more! We had an amazing week staying there. When you look out the front window, it's as if you are looking at a postcard. Kristan was super helpful in helping us find the house and figure out activities. The house and grounds are in great condition and it feels as if you are all but alone on the cliff. If you are looking for a house to relax and get away from everything, you MUST stay here.

Everything was beyond the pictures when we checked in the cliff house around sunset time. It's private, cozy and beautifully decorated. It's right next to the road leading to Waipio's valley so easy for us to hike down the valley. However I think it's better suited for the honeymoon couples or families seeking for privacy. Since there is no restaurant around and 30mins from the town, I don't recommend you to stay over 2 or 3 nights. Also, since the house has been listed on tripadvisor, yelp and lonely planet, I think it's a bit pricey and too commercialized. I'd prefer knowing local ppl with my airbnb stay, but Kristan didn't show up. It's just personal preference.

Our stay at Kristan's was the last stop on our honeymoon. It was by far the most relaxing spot during our stay in Hawaii. The view of the valley is unreal. We could tell that this place sits next to a waterfall since we could hear the rushing of it in the brush. We truly fell in love with this hideaway. This was by far one of our best Airbnb experiences and would love to come back!

Kristan's description of the Hamakua Hideaway is too modest.  Once you're there you'll understand - unlimited beauty, light, air, ocean and mana on tap!  If you're looking for the Four Seasons experience you should stay there instead, but this is the Four Seasons of rustic Kukuihaele.  Like summer camp for adults in paradise.

The house was easy to find, but I don't recommend arriving in a downpour late at night like we did.  We immediately felt at home and we absolutely loved our 6 night stay.  So much so we are planning to return ASAP.

About those dogs - they're the friendliest pack of poi dogs we've ever encountered in Hawaii.   All bark when you arrive, but no bite and pure love.  They adopted us into their pack for the week.

Thanks for keeping old Hawaii alive out on the edge of the island, Kristan.  It's an amazing and wonderful place to rest and recharge and we can't wait to get back.
An even more charming Cliff House than the photos show.  And the setting and views are world class.  Fabulous hideaway.

Kristan made us feel very welcome by respecting our privacy while at the same time making sure we got there ok and had everything we needed.  Turned the light on for us when she saw we had not arrived before nightfall and provided us with good instructions in a place that can be difficult to navigate in the dark.

BEYOND expectations. I truly thought the Photos were like the best angles of the property but words could not describe our reactions when we actually arrived. The view and the colors of the property blew us away. The value here is so worth it. We honestly considered it the best part of our Honeymoon and can't believe this property is shared with other people. If you get an opportunity to go to Big Island This home is not to be missed. We just loved the home, the view, the plants, the little lizards and even friendly neighbor doggies that came to share the sunset. Everything you need to cook, shower, and relax are there. It's super private and the views are out of this world. Highly recommend.

The view from the Cliff House is incredible and the furnishings are clearly curated for comfort and for eye appeal. I had one moment, looking into a mirror and for a moment not being certain if the background reflection was artwork or the actual environment. We hiked from here to the Waipio valley floor and out to the black sand beach. Unforgettable!

We had a fantastic stay at the Hamakua Hideaway Cliff House. It's a beautiful - totally private - setting surrounded by bamboo forest, lush tropical garden and a beautiful view of Waipio Bay. The setting is even more special than the pictures can show. The house is nicely furnished and well equipped. Kitchen and bathroom are well appointed. Couple small items: WiFi was a little intermittent for us, and basic insect precautions needed (house is fully screened, repellent if sitting out in the evening). Overall the perfect 'getaway' spot. This is a very special place and highly recommended!
Amazing place and amazing view, don't miss this!

I really can't say enough about our stay at the Cliff House. From being greeted by dogs the second we arrived (they were extremely friendly), to the view as soon as you step out of your car, it truly was better than advertised. The view from the yard, house, loft & porch is really nicer than we could have even imagined. Good location close to Hilo shops and a grocery store (the whole island can be pretty easily driven in general). Great, romantic getaway that I would absolutely recommend to anyone who is visiting the big island. Thanks!

This was my 2nd time staying at the Cliffhouse Hideaway and I couldn't possibly feel more satisfied and honored to spend my last couple of days there. We get to see a lot of beautiful views while traveling around the islands, but this is one of the best! And you get to see it the second you wake up in the morning until the moment the sun sets. A perfect place to take in the essence of what Hawaii truly is, accompanied by a comfortable bed, a fully functioning kitchen, a jacuzzi tub, a napping nook upstairs, books, binoculars, friendly puppies..... this place has it all!
My husband and I had an amazing time in this little slice of heaven! Breathtaking views, so relaxing!

The Hamakua Hideaway Cliff House is exquisite. It is RIGHT next to the Waipio Valley, so if you are looking to explore that area this is a perfect place. My boyfriend and I walked to the lookout, which I think is about half a mile or less. From there, we walked down to the waterfall and the beach. 

It is a very private little place tucked back on the property. The views are simply amazing, and the big windows ensure that you soak in the view from wherever you are in the house. There is a really cool loft with a little bed as well. The bathtub that looks out at the view is awesome. There are two friendly dogs that hang out around the house, very sweet! The house has everything you need and, to us, is super luxurious. Your phone won't have service there (a plus!) but there is good wifi available. 

Thank you Kristan for sharing this place with the world. The overall energy, vibe, and again, location of the place, really made our trip!
Beautiful spot.  Great house and amazing gardens.

Absolutely amazing! The pictures do not do the view and overall experience justice. It has everything you need from a practical standpoint (great little kitchen, plenty of towels, nice king size bed, privacy, easy to find, parking spot, etc.) but it's the location, view, and unique touches that make this place worth the trip, for example the jet tub overlooking the cliffs, cool rugs and island decor, the love-seat swing outside, and the super friendly pups that visited us each morning and evening. Also a nice walk to Waipio lookout and the beach below. This was such a nice getaway from Honolulu!
Incredible! Unlike any other place we've been to. Waking up to the view of the ocean and valley will forever be in our dreams.
I took My Fiancé for a surprise trip to the cliff house for his Birthday and we the most magical and romantic weekend! Thank you so much for sharing your home. we will be back very soon.
Kristan's spot is absolutely wonderful!  The view is stunning and it's very peaceful!

Absolutely lovely place with breathtaking ocean views. Could see two waterfalls from our front porch. Would definitely recommend. Great hiking nearby in Waipio Valley! Jacuzzi tub with 360 degree view of cliffs and ocean. Saw whales from frothy swing in the morning. Everything you need to cook meals.
Stunning house in a remote and peaceful location. Would highly recommend to anyone looking to explore the quiet side of the Big Island
What an amazing place! The photos don't capture the full beauty of the place and its views. If I come back to the Big Island, I will definitely stay here again.
Stay here if you desire a unique Hawaiian experience away from the mega resorts. We truly enjoyed every minute of our time at the Cliff House!

Cannot begin to describe how amazing this place is.  If you are looking for a spot to be a tourist, where you can walk to shops full of other tourists and go to beaches full of tourists, this is not your place.  However, if you want to experience the big island in all of its glory, this is it.  The house makes you feel like it's just you and the island.  It is, in itself, a destination.  It rained a lot while my wife and I were there and everyday we woke up saying 'if our plans get rained out we'll be perfectly happy staying in, reading in the loft, and soaking in the view'.  

Kristan was easy to reach and a great host.  The house had everything you'd need to feel at home, and its proximity to Honoka'a was great for stocking up on supplies.  

I recommend this place to anyone who wants some peace and quiet and really enjoys being surrounded by nature.  10 stars out of 5.

We loved staying at the cliffhouse. Its a little piece of heaven. The ultamate getaway in a tropical paradise. Rent a 4wd if you go so you can drive down to the black sand beach in the waipio valley which is 5 minutes away. Highly recommended.

Kristan's place was AMAZING.  Even more gorgeous in person.  Hope to make it back someday....mahalo for sharing such a beautiful place.  The icing on the cake were humpback whales breaching in the bay below our last evening there.  Beautiful property and house.
Very unique and charming.  Incredible space to be in.  It may be a little too off-the-beaten-path for some, but it was absolutely perfect for us.

1000 stars. 50 out of 10. 5 thumbs up. 

To say this place is worth the cost would be an extreme understatement. Without a doubt the single best Airbnb experience we've ever had. The space is thoughtfully and elegantly designed, using so many (bug-proof) screens that you feel every breeze and are virtually outside. The residence, which is full of interesting objects and beautiful orchids, literally adjoins a river that feeds the falls, the sound of which is forever present inside the home. It must be one of only a handful of rentals, if not the only one, so close to the heart of Waipio - which is one of the most beautiful and awe-inspiring places on earth. It's more than a luxury accommodation - it's a serene, otherworldly experience that will forever change your perspective. Nearby Honoka'a town is also lovely, and Waipio Cookhouse, the local restaurant down the street from the Cliff House, is not to be missed. They claim, probably correctly, to be the only place on earth that makes pancakes using fresh Waipio valley poi, incredible bacon from valley pigs, etc. Farm to table in the truest sense, and best breakfast we've ever had.

Thanks Kristan and Waipio!

When we arrived we were blown away by the view. Our to-do plans changed instantly. After visiting the farmers market in Honoka'a (10 mins away) we spent the day relaxing at the cottage. Counting boats, exploring the curated artifacts and decor of the cottage, reading parts of the books on the shelves and listening to a couple CD's all provided. Bring some grub and expect to not want to leave!

We spent a week here for our 25th anniversary and What a wonderful cottage!  Spectacular view with an amazing garden.  We ate every meal on the back lawn overlooking the ocean whenever we were home (until the last day when it rained).  2 sweet puppies from next door were there to greet us every time we drove in the driveway.  Saw a mongoose in the yard the first day (dogs kept them away after that) and geckos in the house.  Lots of wildlife and beauty all around.  Well stocked with kitchen items/utensils for cooking at home.  We would definitely recommend!

The cliffhouse view is absolutely incredible. The Waipio Valley brings a calming vibe to the secluded cottage. The cottage has plenty of screened in windows and we loved feeling the breeze through the house- the actual house was quaint and was perfect for the two of us. The price point for the cliffhouse is all about the view... amenities are standard and there were a few things we were missing in the kitchen. Kristan was very communicative via AirBnb message and text. We loved hiking in the valley and checking out Honokaa. Will definitely recommend the cliffhouse to friends!

This was one of the most incredible settings that we have ever stayed at. Unbelievable vistas of Waipio Valley, the ocean, and amazing sunset views. Truly magical. Recommend having a 4wd vehicle to easily access the valley down the very steep road (only low gear 4wd vehicles allowed on the road to the beach below). Looking forward to returning someday!

This is a very special place.  It was soooooo beautiful and peaceful staying there that it was hard to leave during the day to explore.  We loved everything about this quaint little home on the cliff.  We definitely want to come back and plan to stay for a week so we can try to more fully embrace the area.  Thank you Kristan for sharing your wonderful retreat with us!

Just wow! The pictures are beautiful but being there is even better! The home is so welcoming and the views are so spectacular it makes it hard to leave! Which is a good thing because it takes about an hour and a half to get to Kona and a little less than that to get to Hilo. 

However, there is a lot to do nearby! We highly recommend Waipi'o black sand beach! You can hike down or (if you're experienced at off-roading and rented a jeep) you can drive down. We drove down so we could spend more time at the beach and loved every minute. You can even see the cliff house from the beach! 

The bed was so comfy! There is an extensive movie collection. Kristan provided a lot of brochures for local places which we found very helpful! We highly recommend this home!

I hate to share about this place, as it is my favorite "secret hideaway."  The setting is absolutely amazing, with a view you will never forget.  The house itself is nicely furnished with quaint furniture, a nice kitchen and a loft with a killer view.  Though easily accessible from the main road, the location is very private, as if you are in your own world, yet, Kristan, just up the road, is very responsive to any last minute needs or questions.  This place is a great jumping off spot fro hiking down into Waipio Valley, but with the view at the house, you may never want to leave.  Very romantic.

Despite the Photos that we had seen of the Cliffhouse before, our jaws dropped when we entered. The view is beyond compare - from virtually every angle of the cottage. Furthermore, the place has been decorated with much attention to detail so that it truly feels like a home. We'd love to. return

Very secluded, romantic place with stunning views  to the West, down the northern coast of Hawaii's big island. Great attention to details, all amenities there and more.  Very close to the scenic Valley Overlook.  Way better value than any hotel.
